title: Do teenagers know what true love is? - Quora

response.answer_text: I'm in my late teens. Let me tell you this briefly...In my early teens- I felt like I really know what true love is like "being with each other all the time and not only sexual but also mental, to find happiness in their laughs but never let them go for a little while. Hardly I knew what "I want some space" would mean.In my middle teens- I realised that I made some mistakes and I appreciate myself as I learnt many valuable things from them. I realised that true love would be there on a person even being away from them and the distance does only makes us remind how much we love them. I realised what giving space to our loved one would be. I realised that true love could be on that person even if they don't want to be with us. That shows how respectful we're to them and to our love on them. I realised that true love can happen not only on our lover but on a friend and on our family.And now in my late teens-I realized that we make mistakes which teach us a bigger lesson than anything. I realised that true love can happen on more than one person as a lover simultaneously but what we choose will be one sided, what they choose, if syncs with ours we can do what we want to do. I realised that in extreme situations we should make choices which don't ruine other's lives than to think about ourselves. I realised that true lover is not someone who says that they love us unconditionally but one who assures us that we fall to rise again and we love to beloved. The one who fights besides us than opposite to us. I realised that I've got everything from everyone but I should strive more to make them better as they deserve so. I realized that I found a true lover for being a true lover... Which makes me think like kissing them in their happiness and hugging them in their desperation. Yes I know what true love is..!

Knowing about love doesn't depend on your age, it depends on who you are. I am 25 years old and know that I truly loved my first boyfriend when I was 13 years old. People tried to convince me I did not and was too young to understand love, but they were wrong. Time has told me that.  We broke up years ago because of distance, incompatible views, and because our lives were taking us in different directions. Now he is married to someone who is a lot more compatible with him than I would have been. I am truly happy for him. I will always remember him fondly, because he is who taught me what love is in a relationship by example.

Yes I do . That's my opion. I think at any age you can cause I'm sure EVERYONE does REMBER there FIRST love . Even what age to . EVEN if they were in there teens OUR NOT. So yes I do that's just me . I do think at any age . FROM your teen to 100 years old . I mean now days older people dont realize they AND everyone else was a teenager TO. EVEN though some say they weren't AND don't act like it CAUSE there ALL grown up now . But they do REMBER there REMBER though. If they here a old SONG on the radio. Our they see SOMETHING was there THATS not there no more and got tore down . Our they see SOMEONE they went to school WHITH. Our a year BOOK OUR there class reunion. And I DONT think NOW DAYS that the older PEOPLE DONT give the teenagers NOW days the credit they do DESERVE NOW. On growing up WHITH all the new technology around today . CAUSE either they do like it our not . The teenagers now is the future. SO I HOPE AND PRAY THAT I ANSWERED YOUR QUESTION AS BEST AS I COULD DO AND AS HONESTLY AS I CAN P.S: SO MY ANSWER IS YES . BUT PLEASE DO REMBER THOUGH EVEN IF YOU DO GET HURT ON YOUR FIRST LOVE. THERE WILL BE MANY MANY MORE REAL TRUE LOVES IN YOUR LIFE . OUR YOUR FIRST LOVE MIGHT BE THE ONE YOU DO MARRY FOREVER. IVE SEEN THAT HAPPEN. AND AS A TEENAGER DONT EVER LET YOUR LOVE FORCE YOU INTO ANYTHING YOU DONT WANT EVER EVER EVER. AND PLEASE NEVER EVER EVER EVER LET ANY ONE YOU DO FALL IN LOVE WHITH EVER EVER. MISTREAT YOUR OUR EVER EVER ABUSE YOU EVER EVER. THERE ISNT NO LOVE EVER WORTH THAT EVER . PLEASE ALWAYS DO REMBER THAT ALWAYS . AND ALSO STILL KEEP YOUR DREAMS AND DO MAKE THEM COME TRUE TO. IN LIFE. AND WHATEVER YOU WANT TO BE IN LIFE TO.

it depends on a maturity level. And the amount of long term relationships they’ve been in. (long term meaning 3 months. to most teens long term is 2 weeks.) like id say me and one of my freinds know what love is. but havent experinced it. love is wanting your partner to grow and be a better person while remaing themself and wanting to spend time with them because their your significant other right? but i whould say that for the most part a large chunk of teens dont know what love is. but if you think romeo and juliet is a true representation of love. well. i guess all of them know what love is.

Younger teens really don't know what love is compared to older teens, around the ages 16 and up. All because they have not went through enough experiences to know what it is.” “Love has no face,” said Katie Moss, a 50-year-old woman who has been through a lot of relationships.

We sure can. I know, shocking right? I fell in love last year. How do I know it’s love? Because I have such a special feeling towards him. I’d take a bullet for him. I’d spend the rest of my life being dirt poor if it meant we were together. I’d give up everything to make it work. Call me crazy if you wish but I love him. He loves me. We’re planning on getting married after graduation. Age doesn’t define whether or not you can love someone

To the question. What is “true love”, by definition - a person whom one loves. What do you define true love. A relationship that bonds withing time? Love to exist over longer period. I dont know (honest answer). Teenagers have the capability of knowing love. So i will stand by the final answer yes. It also depends on who the teenager is (of course)

Who are we grown-ups to tell anyone that the love they experience isn’t real? Teenagers often feel intensely and deeply, with an earth shattering urgency. They experience romantic love for the first time, in all it’s confusing new-ness. It might not be mature and grounded love yet, and it might be ridden with illusions. But just like a childs fear is real fear, teenage love should be not be dismissed. Teenagers love, hurt and learn about life in the process, and it’s a real, actual part of the human experience.

Yes. Why wouldn't they? They have emotions just like everyone else and just because they're at a certain age doesn't mean they're crazy to identify how they feel. Even if you dont see it that way, you should just let them be happy and live their teen years and learn.

That's a very complicated answer some adults still don't know.lol but its possible sometimes couples grow and mature together but with their hormones changing, moods trying to figure what they feel and it can be love or infatuation as well or even a crush it takes time as long as they are being safe just let it play out

Teenagers may think that they have fallen in love if they meet someone and end up with them for a while. There are many symptoms of love, see How do you know if you're in love? Many think so even when in reality, they are not in love, but it is normally a very magical feeling and even if the relationship ends, it was almost always worth the time.

There’s no such thing as true love. True love is what you can make out of something called a relationship with someone last forever. No matter what. True love isn’t about OMG I CAN’T go without her at all. I NEED HER. But with time. They will just forget. Life is like that.
I won't say no because teen years make you learn! So they're learning!
Yes, just as much as anyone else. What to do with that love is a matter of experience.
No hence the term PUPPY LOVE
